call me crazy but this is my stack:
- warp for terminal commands
- cursor for editing files
- claude code for tedious tasks and code generation
- mintlify for docs
- helicone for ai gateway + llm observability
- claude for chitchat
- gemini for anything image
- notion for writing

@mintlify is the market leader for producing elegant, interactive, and AI-friendly technical documentation, and they make it easy to enable devs to provide @pipedream docs as context for their IDE or coding agent via .md, .txt, or with a remote MCP server

https://pipedream.com/docs/ai-tooling

we shipped some nice upgrades to make it even easier to add tools to your AI agent using @pipedream Connect — SDKs in Python, TypeScript, and Java powered by @buildwithfern, along with first-class and AI-native docs powered by @mintlify 🧵

We partnered with @mintlify to launch a new documentation experience that’s AI-native by design. Check out our latest blog for details: https://www.vantage.sh/blog/ai-docs-mintlify https://pbs.twimg.com/media/G0a8DH6XIAAPneQ.jpg

The fact that @mintlify automatically spins up an MCP server on your docs is genius.
